content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
──────────────────────────────
### Extraction System at (–3.5, 27.5)
Consists of:
• Extraction burner inserter at (–3.5, 27.5) with drop position (–3.5, 28.5)
Use-case:
• Provides the extraction node for drawing items from the source before feeding them into the belt network.

### Copper Cable Factory at (≈2.5, 17.5)
Consists of:
• Factory burner inserter at (2.5, 16.5) retrieved as part of the factory interface
• Cable factory input chest at (2.5, 17.5)
• Dedicated factory burner inserter at (3.5, 17.5) placed using direction RIGHT adjacent to the chest
• Assembling machine (assembler) at (1.5, 19.5) connected as a neighbour
Use-case:
• Serves as the processing station for copper cable production by receiving inputs via the chest and inserters and feeding components to the assembling machine.

### Depot Belt System at (≈3.5, 15.5)
Consists of:
• Belt depot wooden chest at (3.5, 15.5) crafted and placed to serve as the depot
• Adjacent transport belt segment at (4.5, 15.5) linking to the depot
• Depot burner inserter at (3.5, 14.5) placed using direction UP next to the chest
Use-case:
• Acts as an isolated belt depot to integrate the extraction network with the production line, routing items through a dedicated belt segment and inserter.

ERROR TIPS
──────────────────────────────
• Transport Belt Connection Errors  
  – Error Message: “Transport belts cannot be connected directly to a Prototype.SteamEngine object as a target. You need to add an inserter that inputs items into Prototype.SteamEngine and use the inserter as the target entity.”  
  – Tip: Always verify that the belt connection targets an appropriate inserter rather than a steam engine; adjust the target by adding or using an inserter to ensure correct linkage.

• Entity Placement Distance Errors  
  – Error Message: “Could not place wooden-chest at (3.5,15.5), The target position is too far away… The player position is (0, 0) … Move closer.”  
  – Tip: Ensure that the player or placement cursor is within the allowed distance from the target before attempting to place an entity.

• Undefined Variable Reference  
  – Error Message: “NameError: name ‘target_chest’ is not defined … Did you mean one of these? [‘target_pos’, ‘target_place_pos’, ‘depot_chest’]”  
  – Tip: Double-check that all variables are correctly defined and referenced consistently to avoid undefined identifier errors.
